mobs.long_desc: The Great White Shark hunts restlessly beneath the waves.
mobs.desc: Much to your dismay, the old sailor's tales are true: A leviathan-like white shark has caught your scent - sleek and dangerous, the great predator is the most feared creature of the sea, and it's swimming your way!  Mottled white skin and thick, tough-looking wrinkles cover the length of the great beast's ancient frame.  Clearly this great shark has lived a long life thus far, and it doesn't show any signs of giving up any time soon.  Its muscles ripple in time with the deep currents as it knifes through the water, searching, hunting, for a little fish, for a big fish, for you...

mobs.long_desc: A black-scaled fish swims in manic circles through the dim water.
mobs.desc: Large, cold eyes stare back at you as you gaze upon the most deadly fish of the sea, the black barracuda.  Swarming in a hideous group of its kin, this fish lures its prey by creating swirling currents that drag and pull at any who are foolish enough to venture near.  The cold scales of the barracuda's body are, as its name suggests, a deep gloomy black.  As the fish swims by, your mind cannot help but compare this horrid creature to a mobile black hole with sharp fins and a gaping, needle-filled maw.

mobs.long_desc: A sleek and deadly shark approaches you.
mobs.desc: This large, knife-like predator has one sharp fin that pokes up from the water, swishing gracefully as it swims.  Its other fins are deadly and graceful, effortlessly moving its lithe grey body through the water.  It has several rows of sharp, hooked white teeth on its top and bottom jaws, and can open its mouth to a truly prodigious width.

mobs.long_desc: A flying fish soars above the waves as if executing a graceful jete.
mobs.desc: This incredible animal seems almost as if it desires to transcend the boundaries of its nature to become one with the birds.  Its shimmering scales sparkle in the hot sun as it leaps above the waves and dives gracefully back in to the water.

mobs.long_desc: A golden sunfish floats near the surface, basking in its namesake.
mobs.desc: Sparkling in the sun, it is easy to see how this fish got its name. As it lounges languidly beneath the hot rays of the sun, it seems to be a miniature star unto itself, swimming tranquilly through the clear water.

mobs.long_desc: A vibrantly coloured paradise fish brings light to the water as it swims past.
mobs.desc: Clearly a tropical fish, the paradise fish is vibrantly coloured with bright orange, blue, and light-green scales. What is most interesting though, is not the scales of its body, but the scales of its belly, which glow softly to illuminate the water around it.

mobs.long_desc: The Giant Squid hovers ominously below you, long tentacles weaving...
mobs.desc: Larger than any creature you have seen by land or sea, the Giant Squid declares iself chief denizen of the depths.  Its great rope-like tentacles ripple with strange muscles as they reach for you in an attempt to draw you in to feed the strange maw at the creature's core.  You cannot see the creatures eyes, nor make out any features other than the deep purple mass of its hulking frame and the great whipping tentacles that thrash from it.

mobs.long_desc: A sinister eel stares blindly at you from the dark ocean floor.
mobs.desc: Truly one of the most hideous creatures extant, the mud brown eel's snake-like body slithers through the depths. Beady eyes appear to stare out piercingly into the gloom, but in reality the eel is blind, relying on its sense of smell to search out its food. Which should alarm you as its nostrils are pointed your way!

mobs.long_desc: Ugly as sin, a brutish hagfish waddles through the water here.
mobs.desc: This horridly repugnant little fish seems completely out of place among the wonderfully coloured variants of tropical aquatic life that bring life to the sea. Its body is a mottled grey-brown, and it's pugfaced snout veers up like a sea-going hog.  You could almost swear you heard it snort.

mobs.long_desc: A flashy-coloured sea slug winks at you from below the waves.
mobs.desc: This slug, properly known as a nudibranch, is a huge variation of the common slug found on land.  Different too, from the land-going species, is the sea slug's colouring: a startling blue that blends with the colour of the sea and can only be seen at brief intervals as an underwater twinkling. Peering closer, you see the creature has large eyes on a long stalk stretching from its lumpy body.  The eye seems to wink at you. How bizarre!

mobs.long_desc: A clear jellyfish swims by, silent and deadly.
mobs.desc: A gelatinous, umbrella-shaped jellyfish swims here, its invertebrate form extending and contracting as it propels itself silently along. Trailing behind the creature are long thin tentacles... beware their sting!

mobs.long_desc: A gaunt white ghost wails above the ocean waves.
mobs.desc: Floating before you is the spirit of the Arabel Ocean, the Lady of the Sea. Legends tell of her capricious nature, veering wildly between placid calm and tempestuous rage.  The waters of the ocean and the winds of the sky rise to meet her mood.  Something has twisted and enraged the Lady, who has surrounded herself in howling winds and pounding waves.  Her eyes, filled with furious rushing waters and blasting rain, spell doom for any caught in her wake.

mobs.long_desc: Thick blue fog rises ominously off the water.
mobs.desc: The eponymous Blue-Fog has coalesced into a thick, eerily glowing cloud, floating above the river and lake that is its true form.  Haunting moans of the hundreds who have drowned in its watery depths echo in time with its softly pulsating luminous glow.  With no distinct figure or shape, the Blue-Fog is both everywhere and nowhere.

mobs.long_desc: A shining watery bird soars through the steam.
mobs.desc: The spirit of the Phoenix Feather Hot Springs has manifested in the form of the legendary bird for which it is named.  It flies through the sky above the springs, riding the rising currents one watery wings.  Five lustrous feathers fan out from the Phoenix's tail like a glorious fan, leaving a trail of steam like smoke from fire.

mobs.long_desc: A three-faced humanoid figure rises from the water.
mobs.desc: The watery humanoid body of the Three-Falls Totem is topped by a head with three animal faces, one for each tribe in its canyon home: a bear, an eagle, and a cougar.  Its rhythmic movements form a kind of dance, flowing like the river it belongs to.  Each step echoes with the sound of the rushing rapids in an endless cycle of rhythm and sound.

mobs.long_desc: A hideous green woman with a distended mouth and belly crawls through the sea.
mobs.desc: Putrid green skin hangs loose off the horrifying visage of the monstrous sea hag, the spirit of the Greengreen Sea.  She ravenously shovels anything she can reach into a gaping cavernous maw which dominates her face.  An enormous distended belly sags between her legs as she laboriously crawls her way through the water, looking for something to devour.

mobs.long_desc: The sea's currents manifest into the ripples of a beautiful song.
mobs.desc: Barely visible ripples of harmonious music rise from the depths of the ocean. Each delicate sound chimes like a bell, forming snippets of old tunes sung to the memory of ancient deep.  Together they form a gentle, drifting melody, like a lullaby for an infant adrift in a sea of sound and music.

mobs.keywords: Ghost-frozen-north willowy icy white woman spirit
mobs.short_desc: the Ghost of the Frozen North
mobs.long_desc: A willowy icy white woman strides across the lake.
mobs.desc: Striding coldly across the waters of Frost Lake, dressed in resplendent robes and an icy crown, is the manifestation of its commanding spirit, white as the blinding snow.  The temperature around her somehow drops even further as ice crystals form under her unnaturally graceful steps.  Deep icy hatred shines from her ice blue eyes and a cruel smile lingers ever so slightly on her ruby red lips.

mobs.short_desc: the Spirit of the Darkest Depths
mobs.long_desc: An inky black shade rises from the depths.
mobs.desc: Infernal malevolence wafts off this murky beast, chilling even the most resolute followers of darkness.  It vaguely resembles a winged humanoid with two massive black horns growing from its head and curved around its face, yet against the dark waters of the Black Lake it's impossible to fully comprehend it.  Its form seems to be made more of a viscous goo than water, more like the dark heart of Garl'lixxil than anything from Ethilien.

mobs.long_desc: A translucent blue woman plays joyfully in the moonlit waves.
mobs.desc: It looks unfinished.  C/ The spirit of the Dreaming River takes form as an undine, a kind of mystical water spirit in the shape of a beautiful woman. She floats along the moonlit river, singing softly to the sky above in a dreamlike reverie, mermaid-like in her lilting voice.  Tiny iridescent scales cover her skin, shimmering in the moonlight.  She is a breath-taking sight to behold in such a magical place.

objects.ground: A deep blue diamond on a silver necklace floats by.

extras.text: This deep, dark blue diamond in a silver filigree setting has an obvious supernatural quality to it.  The inner minerals of the gemstone seem to slosh and swirl as it moves, almost like the gem was made of water.  It is set in a fine silver chain encrusted with tiny sparkling white diamonds, reflecting dazzling light in all directions.  This exquisite necklace must be worth a fortune!

mecho %self.name% wails, 'YOU SHALL DIE FOR STEALING FROM ME.' wait 7s mecho The nine Great Waters pull away from the settlement's borders as if granting a moment of reprieve. wait 4s mecho The ocean's level drops as the waters quickly rush away. wait 4s mecho On the horizon, a titanic wall of water rises up like a hellish behemoth. wait 2s mecho The gargantuan tsunami rushes toward the rocks and SMASHES through the settlement gate! wait 6s mecho Screaming voices are instantly snuffed out. mecho Dozens of bodies smash into the rocks and shatter like glass as the tsunami obliterates the settlement. wait 8s mecho As quickly as it began, the flood waters recede leaving nothing but chilling silence and carnage in its wake. wait 6s mecho The Lady of the Sea vanishes beneath the waves. m_run_room_trig 39013 wait 4s msend %actor% A watery voice floats past your ear: msend %actor% 'Never forget what you have witnessed here today.' wait 1s msend %actor% It whispers the eldritch formula for summoning such a cataclysm again. quest complete flood %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% flood msend %actor% &4&bYou have learned Flood.&0 wait 2s msend %actor% 'Thank you for the role you played.' mpurge %self% else return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. say This is not my heart! I will join the ocean's crusade.'&0 quest variable flood %actor.name% water2 1 wait 2s mecho %color%With a mighty cry %self.name% dives back into the water.&0 else return 0 mecho %self.name% says, %color%'This will not keep my spring sufficiently warm.'&0 endif else return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. mecho %self.name% says, %color%'I need nothing from you.'&0 endif break case 39016 set color &2 if %stage% == 1 if %object.type% == food if %actor.quest_variable[flood:%object.vnum%]% wait 2 mecho %self.name% wails in anger as she thrashes about! mecho %self.name% throws %object.shortdesc% into the sea! mecho %self.name% says, %color%'I have already eaten that!  I refuse to eat it again!'&0 else quest variable flood %actor.name% %object.vnum% 1 set full %actor.quest_variable[flood:hunger]% eval hunger (%full% + %object.val0%) quest variable flood %actor.name% %color%'The dead within me are sated.' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, %color%'For now.' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, %color%'We will join with the ocean in her revenge.' wait 1s mecho triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[flood]% scream wait 2 mecho %self.name% shrieks, 'HOW DARE YOU!!!' wait 1s mdamage %actor% 400 msend %actor% %self.name% fills your lungs with water! (&4&b%damdone%&0) mechoaround %actor% %self.name% fills %actor.name%'s lungs with water! (&4&b%damdone%&0) wait 2s emote holds her hands in front of her. wait 1s mecho Water flows up %self.name%'s body and swirls around her arms. wait 1s mecho The water coalesces into a shimmering jewel in the Lady's outstreched hands. wait 1s mload obj 39000 give heart %actor% say Do not make this mistake again, Envoy. endif

rooms.name: Off the Shore
rooms.description: Directly behind you, enshrouded in misty whisps of blue-grey fog, lies the familar sanctuary of the mainland.  The run-down streets, and tired buildings of Specula seem safe and comforting in the face of the awesome ocean spread out before you.  The panoramic views that enticed you from the beach are now more than a little frightening - yet still beautiful.  The currents dictate your passage here: South takes you out to sea, while North carries you back towards safety and the shore.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.name: Far Off the Coast of Specula
rooms.description: A distant smoky mirage is all that can be seen of the now far-off shoreline to your North.  Dominating your field of view is the enormous sea of fog and water that seems infinite from your vantage point here among the waves.  To your West are dangerous and impassable rocks, and nothing but salt-water lies to your North, South and East.

North.description: Faint lights and bizarre shapes possibly denote land.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.name: Off the Coast of Specula
rooms.description: A distant smoky mirage is all that can be seen of the now far-off shoreline behind you.  Dominating your field of view is the enormous sea of fog and water that seems infinite from your vantage point here amongst the waves.  To your North and East are dangerous and impassable rocks, and nothing but salt-water lies to the South and West.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

West.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the West.

rooms.name: Among the Waves of the Blue Fog Sea
rooms.description: A thin misty line to the North could possibly be land, but your eye is drawn to other things: to the fiery sun above, to the crashing waves around you, and to the countless variations of brilliantly coloured aquatic life swarming below the surface of the clear green water.  A dangerous reef lies to your West and open sea greets you in every other direction.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.name: Off the Reefs
rooms.description: To your West and North lie the Great Reefs: treacherous and impassable rocks known as the "Sailor's Bane".  Barely visible far off to your South-West shines a great green emerald jutting from the sea to sparkle in the sun - Perhaps landfall could be made on this fabulous isle?  To the South and East the great ocean stretches on into oblivion.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.name: The Blue Fog Sea
rooms.description: Before you, and on all sides, extends a vast expanse of cool colours. Where your eyes blur and the horizon begins, the greys, the greens, and the blues of the ocean blend into the sky.  Struck by the beauty and by the sheer immensity of your surroundings, you feel unimportant, you feel insignificant, and most of all, you feel so terribly vulnerable.  North, South, East, West, it doesn't seem to matter much - the water is everywhere.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.name: Bordering the Great Reefs
rooms.description: To your North, South, and West, lie the Great Reefs: treacherous and impassable rocks known as the "Sailor's Bane".  Barely visible past the reefs is the "Shining City" of Odaishyozen.  With the sun beating down, it appears to be a great emerald on the face of the huge volcano that forms the island.  If only the reef wasn't directly in your path, perhaps you could make your way to the jungle that spreads across the north face of the island.  As it is, you can only return East to the great emptiness of the ever-present sea.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

rooms.name: Off the Rocks
rooms.description: Great shards of rock jut violently from the sea to your South as the Great Reefs continue in that direction.  Still further to the South is the Eastern face of a fantastically beautiful island.  From here you can only see the steep cliff-like rocks that are it's border, but you have heard many a tale of the isle's natural beauty in both flora and fauna.  If the rocks did not mar your path, perhaps you could witness these sights yourself.  As it is you can only sail on to the North, West, and East, following the sun, or maybe a star in your travels.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

rooms.name: Off the Coast of Fiery Island
rooms.description: Treacherously beautiful, brilliantly coloured coral reefs surround you to the North and East.  Almost as if they were designed to, the reefs form a protective barrier around the paradise-like isle that lies to your distant East.  Beyond the coral, the island reaches beyond the grasp of the sea to stretch towards the sky in the shape of a great, foreboding, volcanic mound. Despite the fiery nature of this tropical island, it is covered in luscious greenery and its soft beaches and wild jungles are curiously inviting. Unfortunately, because of the sharp coral, the land is inaccessible from this part of the ocean.  To your South and West the waves continue, inevitably,to some far-off shore.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

West.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the West.

rooms.name: Bordering the Great Reefs
rooms.description: To your West and South lie the Great Reefs: treacherou and impassable rocks known as the "Sailor's Bane.  " Barely visible past the reefs is the "Shining City" of Odaishyozen.  With the sun beating down it appears to be a great emerald on the face of the huge volcano that forms the basis for the island. If only the reef wasn't directly in your path, perhaps you could make your way to the jungle that is visible to your West, spreading across the North face of the island.  As it is, you can only return East or North to the great emptiness of the sea.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

rooms.name: Off the Southern Tip of the Great Reefs
rooms.description: Violent currents caused by the narrow water-passages of the Great Reefs to your South rage and spit as they course around you.  Seagulls circle noisily overhead and sea-breeze whips your hair into submission.  Nowhere in the great Blue Fog Sea nor in all the lands it touches is the great power of the goddess of nature so apparent.  Death on the rocks lies to the South and deathly tedious miles of homogenous ocean roll on in every other direction.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

Struck by the beauty and by the sheer immensity of your surroundings, you feel unimportant, you feel insignificant, and most of all, you feel so terribly vulnerable.  North, South, East, West, it doesn't seem to matter much - the water is everywhere.

rooms.name: Off the Coast of Fiery Island
rooms.description: Treacherously beautiful, brilliantly coloured coral reefs surround you to the North and East.  Almost as if they were designed to, the reefs form a protective barrier around the paradise-like isle that lies to your distant East.  Beyond the coral, the island reaches beyond the grasp of the sea to stretch towards the sky in the shape of a great, foreboding, volcanic mound. Despite the fiery nature of this tropical island, it is covered in luscious greenery and its soft beaches and wild jungles are curiously inviting. Unfortunately, because of the sharp coral, the land is inaccessible from this part of the ocean.  To your South and West the waves continue, inevitably, to some far-off shore.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

West.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the West.

rooms.name: Off the Southern Tip of the Great Reefs
rooms.description: Violent currents caused by the narrow water-passages of the Great Reefs to your West rage and spit as they course around you.  Seagulls circle noisily overhead and the sea-breeze whips your hair into wild submission.  Nowhere in the great Blue Fog Sea, nor in all the lands it touches, does the great power of the goddess of nature seem so apparent.  Death on the rocks lies to the West, and deathly tedious miles of homogenous ocean roll on in every other direction.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

rooms.name: Off the Cliffs of the Emerald Isle
rooms.description: A great wall of vertical rock slices its way to the sky from out of the water that crashes fiercely against it to your West.  Glimmering high above this natural cliff is the fabled "Shining City" of Odaishyozen.  You wish so that you could explore its riches but from here you can only stare up the face of these jagged rocks and dream.  Perhaps if the Great Reefs didn't extend this far down South you could make your way onto the island to the North.  Alas, this is not possible, but there is still a chance that the key to the mysterious entrance to the isle is to be found to the South or to the East where the seemingly infinite ocean rolls on and on...

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.name: South of the Lagoon
rooms.description: Directly beyond the vibrant and vicious coral reef to your North is a peaceful looking lagoon who's tranquil waters contrast sharply with the smashing waves of the ocean around you.  Perhaps this little lagoon is the way in to the fabulous beauty of the fiery island that stretches beyond it to your North and East.  Still the point is moot, as the coral continues to bar your path, leaving possible paths to your South, West, and East, but not North towards the islands shores.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

West.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the West

rooms.name: In Sight of the Lagoon
rooms.description: A short distance to your North there is a break in the barrier of coral reef that has restricted your progress thus far - perhaps this is your chance to gain access to the lagoon and the tropical beaches to your North.  Still the water there is somehow darker than you've seen it elsewhere and as you recall tales of sharks among the reefs you begin to question whether it's worth venturing or not.  The safety and monotony of the open sea beckons to your West and hidden rocks impede progress to your South and East.

North.description: The Ocean narrows and the lagoon begins to your North.

West.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the West.

rooms.name: At the Entrance to the Fiery Lagoon
rooms.description: On either side to your East and West are fabulous coral reefs - where you stand appears to be the only place where access to the lagoon, and through it to the island, is possible.  The waters of the lagoon to your North are deathly still when compared to the chaotic swirling of the tumultuous sea around you. It's almost as if the water is paying tribute to the god of mayhem, but that his realm extends not to the North, but to the South where the ocean stretches its arms languidly towards infinity.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.description: Before you, and on all sides, extends a vast expanse of cool colours. Where your eyes blur and the horizon begins, the greys, the greens, and the blues of the ocean blend into the sky.  Struck by the beauty and by the sheer immensity of your surroundings, you feel unimportant, you feel insignificant, and most of all, you feel so terribly vulnerable.  North, South, East, West, it doesn't seem to matter much - the water is everywhere.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

rooms.name: Bordering the Eastern Rocks
rooms.description: Surrounding you to your South and East are a great scattering of sharp rocks and gigantic boulders piercing through the sea's cool cloak to menace your path.  To the West and North the ocean sings a lullaby on the breeze that floats on down to caress your ear.  Since South and East are out, your path here isn't hard to find.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

West.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the West.

rooms.name: Off the Cliffs of the Emerald Isle
rooms.description: A great wall of vertical rock slices its way to the sky from out of the water that crashes fiercely against it to your West.  Glimmering high above this natural cliff is the fabled "Shining City" of Odaishyozen.  You wish so that you could explore its riches but from here you can only stare up the face of these jagged rocks and dream.  Perhaps if the Great Reefs didn't extend this far down South you could make your way onto the island to the North.  Alas, this is not possible, but there is still a chance that the key to the mysterious entrance to the isle is to be found to the South or to the East where the seemingly infinite ocean rolls on and on...

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.name: Bordering the Eastern Rocks
rooms.description: To your immediate East is a great scattering of sharp rocks and gigantic boulders that are piercing through the sea's cool cloak to menace your path. To the West and North the ocean sings a lullaby on the breeze that floats on down to caress your ear.  In every direction but East, the water is open to your gaze, and to your body should you decide to travel on.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea extends to your South in a narrow water-way between the rocks.

West.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the West.

rooms.name: Off the Cliffs of the Emerald Isle
rooms.description: A great wall of vertical rock slices its way up to the sky from out of the water that crashes fiercely against it to the North and West.  Glimmering high above this natural cliff is the fabled "Shining City" of Odaishyozen.  You wish so that you could explore its riches, but from here you can only stare up the face of these jagged rocks and dream.  Perhaps if the Great Reefs didn't extend this far down South, you could make your way onto the island to the North or West.  Alas, this is not possible - perhaps the key to the mysterious island's entrance lies to your East - in any case the jagged rocks surrounding you make this your only choice.

In all other directions the ocean sings a lullaby on the breeze that floats on down to caress your ear.  Since the West is out, your possible paths are to the North, to the South and to the East.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.name: The Blue Fog Sea
rooms.description: Before you, and on all sides, extends a vast expanse of cool colours. Where your eyes blur and the horizon begins, the greys, the greens, and the blues of the ocean blend into the sky.  Struck by the beauty and by the sheer immensity of your surroundings, you feel unimportant, you feel insignificant, and most of all, you feel so terribly vulnerable.  North, South, East, West, it doesn't seem to matter much - the water is everywhere.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

West.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the West.

rooms.name: North of the Southern Reefs
rooms.description: The ocean seems to pull you in an Easterly direction here, and the rapid and dangerous currents prevent you from venturing any further South.  You find this dismaying, as you can see a gorgeous sandy beach of fine white sand in the not-too-far-off distance to your South.  On a comforting note, there are rumored to be deadly flying creatures that infest that self-same beach so you are probably safer where you are.  Though it would be difficult, you could escape the currents to your North or follow them with abandon to your East.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

rooms.name: North of the Southern Reefs
rooms.description: The ocean seems to pull you in an Easterly direction here, towards a violent rock outcrop that would spell catastrophe to any venturing in that direction by sea.  The dangerously rapid currents here also prevent you from venturing any further South.  You find this dismaying, as you can see a gorgeous sandy beach of fine white sand and what appears to be a wrecked ship to the not too far off South.  On a more comforting note, there are rumored to be deadly flying creatures making their home on that self-same beach so you are probably safer where you are.  Though it would be difficult, you could escape the currents to your North.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

rooms.name: Beneath the Crumbling Arch
rooms.description: The cool breeze and cooler water extend, as ever, around you; what catches your eye, however, is not the ocean beneath you, but the massive stone column arching above your head.  It appears to have once stretched on further than you can see to your North; but over time, it seems to have fallen victim to the slow assault of wind and rain, and is now eroded and crumbling - a frail and broken shadow of it's former mass and beauty.  Perhaps the many reefs and rocks that seem to infest this sea were caused by the destruction of this once-great bridge?  The overhead stone shadow continues to your South and fallen rocks to your West make that way inaccessible.  As you have come to expect, the great and inevitable sea stretches out further than your eyes can see to your East and North.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South as does the crumbling arch.

rooms.name: East of the Southern Reefs
rooms.description: To your dismay, but not to your surprise, the great Southern Reefs do indeed reach this far West, just as you feared they might.  However the freedom of movement inherent in the open sea is readily available to your North, South and West.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

West.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the West.

rooms.name: Below the Stone Arch
rooms.description: You stand in semi-darkness with a great stone arch over you blocking the sun's fiery warmth and bright light.  The arch continues on over the sea to your North and seems to have its beginnings on some rocky terrain to your South.  Beyond it's base on either side there appears to be firm, dry land that extends for some distance all around...  An island perhaps?  Certainly worth exploring, anyway.  The sea stretches on to your North and giant rocks impede any potential progress to your East and West.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea and the great stone arch extend further to your North.

Up.description: You see the base of the great spanning arch above you, and beyond it, land...

rooms.name: The Blue Fog Sea
rooms.description: Before you, and on all sides, extends a vast expanse of cool colours. Where your eyes blur and the horizon begins, the greys, the greens, and the blues of the ocean blend into the sky.  Struck by the beauty and by the sheerimmensity of your surroundings, you feel unimportant, you feel insignificant, and most of all, you feel so terribly vulnerable.  A glance to your South only reinforces this feeling of vulnerability as you notice the water there is somehow a little less clear, almost dim, and is twisting and thrashing about wildly like the edge of a gigantic liquid vortex.  You'd better stick to the North, West or East.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

North.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the North.

rooms.name: In the Clutch of the Whirlpool
rooms.description: Deep in the greedy clutch of the swirling liquid around you, you can only pray to the god or goddess of your choice for some mercy as the currents carry you faster and faster to your inevitable demise.  You cannot fight it, East with the flow is your only option.

East.description: The water rushes on to the East, dragging you with it.

rooms.name: In the Clutch of the Whirlpool
rooms.description: Deep in the greedy clutch of the swirling liquid around you, you can only pray to the god or goddess of your choice for some mercy as the currents carry you faster and faster to your inevitable demise.  You cannot fight it, East with the flow is your only option.

East.description: The water rushes on to the East, dragging you with it.

rooms.name: In the Clutch of the Whirlpool
rooms.description: Deep in the greedy clutch of the swirling liquid around you, you can only pray to the god or goddess of your choice for some mercy as the currents carry you faster and faster to your inevitable demise.  The dreadful circle bends here, and the water courses violently to the South - you cannot fight it, South is where you must go.

South.description: Carrying through with the dreadful circular motion of the vortex, the water flows South.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Vortex
rooms.description: Violent currents reach out and grab at you pulling you incessantly to the South and down into the whirlpool's deadly center.  This is your last chance to fight it, and return to the North; however, you are curiously compelled to abandon your will and let the water carry you to the darkness of the vortex's center where some bizarre phenomenon must be occuring.

North.description: Freedom from the currents is visible not far off, fight and you might make it

South.description: The rapidly swirling waters curve ahead, and drag you with them fiercely.

rooms.name: Entrance to a Narrow Inlet
rooms.description: A rocky outcrop to your West appears to be the beginning of a narrow inlet that flows North towards a wider bay at it's base.  Further, beyond the bay, lie sandy white beaches the likes of which your eyes have never beheld. Sparkling in the sun the beaches could be granulated diamond dust for all their beauty.  The beaches appear to extend up towards firmer land that is covered in lush greenery - truly this is a beautiful island.  Rocks bar your path to the West, but this is of no consequence, as the beauty to the North calls you in that direction, and that direction only.  Theoretically, it would be possible to sail on to your South or East, but who would want to, in the face of such paradise?

North.description: A narrow inlet extends towards a wider bay here.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

rooms.name: East of the Inlet
rooms.description: The Blue Fog Sea, as ever, presses on around you...  To your North, however, there appears to be the rocky outcrop of an inlet's natural border.  This way is closed, but perhaps to your West there is an entrance to this fine sparkling clear-watered bay.  The inlet itself seems to stretch on to meet soft sandy beaches a ways to the North.  Possibly, this could be the famed semi-tropical isle of Odaishyozen, of which you have heard so many wild tales.  At any rate, it deserves a closer look.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

West.description: The inlet appears to have an entrance here.

rooms.description: Deep in the greedy clutch of the dark swirling liquid around you, you can only pray to the god or goddess of your choice for some mercy as the currents carry you faster and faster to your inevitable demise.  You cannot fight it, North with the flow is your only option.

North.description: The currents drag you incessantly to the North, resistance is futile...

rooms.name: The Raging Liquid Vortex
rooms.description: To your horror and shock, the great chaotic vortex that has swept you this far is the effect of a great swarm of vicious Barracuda swimming in vast manic circles to trap their prey!  The darkness of the water was not merely caused by a lack of sun, but by the drained blood of the countless creatures who have fallen prey to the deadly fish here.  The dragging sensation that has forced you this far has not let up, and you are now faced with two possible deaths: you will drown, or be devoured...  A sarcastic voice in your head asks you, "And what manner of death will you be having tonight, sir?  "

Down.description: The currant is pulling you under the water!

rooms.name: In the Clutch of the Whirlpool
rooms.description: Deep in the greedy clutch of the swirling liquid around you, you can only pray to the god or goddess of your choice for some mercy as the currents carry you faster and faster to your inevitable demise.  The dreadful circle bends here, and the water courses violently to the West, towards the horrible eye of this twisting rush of oppressive water - you cannot fight it, West, to your death, is where you must go.

West.description: Carrying through with the dreadful circular motion of the vortex, the water flows West.

rooms.name: The Blue Fog Sea
rooms.description: Before you, and on all sides, extends a vast expanse of cool colours. Where your eyes blur and the horizon begins, the greys, the greens, and the blues of the ocean blend into the sky.  Struck by the beauty and by the sheer immensity of your surroundings, you feel unimportant, you feel insignificant, and most of all, you feel so terribly vulnerable.  North, South, East, West, it doesn't seem to matter much - the water is everywhere.

East.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the East.

South.description: The Blue Fog Sea rolls on to the South.

South.description: A sturdy gate holds back the sea.
